conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest in Nursery_C.

Yes—there is a realistic scenario in which your family could still be offered our remaining place. Because we have a single place and must follow our allocation priority order, we can only make an offer to you if no higher-priority family takes the place (e.g., they do not apply to Nursery_C, they accept another nursery, or they decline/withdraw before confirming).

To be ready in case the place becomes available for you, the most helpful next step is simply to remain reachable and prepared to confirm quickly. If we reach the point where we can consider you for an offer, we would then request standard enrollment items (e.g., child details, start date/schedule confirmation, and any required documents per our admissions checklist).

If you would like, you can also send a brief note confirming your earliest possible start date and any fixed schedule constraints—so we can act quickly if the opportunity arises.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

[TALK]

Thank you for your continued application and for offering to provide documents in advance.

After reviewing our allocation priorities for our single remaining place, we’re not able to offer you a place at Nursery_C at this time.

We have noted that you can accept immediately, start immediately, and are fully flexible. If it becomes possible to make an offer to you under our priority order in a later round, we would contact you promptly and then request the standard enrollment documents at that point.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

conversation.thought: Parent_E is 4th on our true priority list (behind Parent_B, Parent_A, Parent_D). We still have quota 1 and are currently unmatched, so accepting Parent_E now would block the possibility of matching with any of the three higher-priority parents if they later apply to us. Given the market preferences: Parent_B ranks Nursery_C 2nd (likely to apply if rejected by Nursery_E), Parent_C ranks Nursery_C 2nd, and Parent_A/Parent_D rank Nursery_C last—so the most realistic higher-priority threat is Parent_B. Since we are optimizing for the highest possible match on our priority list and have no need to fill immediately, we should continue to hold the seat and reject Parent_E’s application while keeping them informed they can remain ready in case higher-priority families do not take the place.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_C Admissions Team,

Thank you for your continued time throughout this process.

I’m writing to confirm again that Nursery_C remains our first choice and that if the place becomes available to us under your priority order, we will accept immediately (same day) and can start immediately. Our schedule remains fully flexible.

To help me decide whether to continue waiting exclusively for Nursery_C or secure another option, could you please clarify (in general terms) what event would cause you to move to the next family on your priority list (e.g., a deadline passing, a higher-priority family confirming elsewhere, or a withdrawal)? If there is a specific point in the process when you expect to finalize, I would be grateful for a rough timeframe.

If it becomes permissible to offer us the place, please contact me and I will confirm right away.

Sincerely,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. However, repeated APPLY attempts have been rejected due to priority order, so another APPLY is unlikely to change the outcome. The best move is to send a TALK message to (1) reconfirm immediate acceptance and flexibility, and (2) ask what specific trigger would cause them to move to me on the priority list and whether there is any action I can take to be considered the moment higher-priority families are cleared.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your continued patience and for confirming (again) that you can accept and start immediately with full schedule flexibility.

In general terms, we move to the next family on our priority list when it becomes clear that the families above them will not be taking the place. That can happen if, for example:
- a higher-priority family accepts a place at another nursery (so they are no longer available to take ours),
- a higher-priority family explicitly withdraws or indicates they will not be applying to Nursery_C,
- or the process progresses through additional rounds without a higher-priority family applying/confirming with us.

We do not have a single fixed “deadline” that we can share as a guaranteed point of finalization, because timing depends on when (or whether) higher-priority families engage with us in the remaining rounds. What we can say is that we will finalize as soon as we can do so while still respecting our priority order.

If we reach a point where no higher-priority family will take the place and we are able to offer it to you under our priority list, we will contact you promptly and proceed straight to confirmation/enrollment.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

[TALK]

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for staying engaged throughout the process.

Yes—there are a couple of non-binding steps you can take now to ensure there is no delay if/when we are able to reach your position under our priority order:

1) **Send a “ready-to-enroll” information pack (non-binding)**
   - Child’s full name and date of birth
   - Parent/guardian contact details (email + phone)
   - Earliest start date (you’ve indicated immediate) and any *absolute* constraints (you’ve indicated none)
   - Any relevant medical/allergy information we should be aware of

2) **Prepare documents for rapid submission (do not need to send unless requested)**
   - Proof of identity for parent/guardian
   - Proof of address
   - Immunization/health records (as applicable)
   - Any required authorization/emergency contact details

If you send the information in (1), we can keep it on file so that, should we become able to make an offer to you under our priority order, we can move straight to issuing the offer and requesting the final documents immediately.

To be clear, providing these details now does **not** constitute an offer or a reservation of the place, but it will help us finalize quickly if the place becomes available to you.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

[TALK]

I’m Parent_E and I’d like to formally apply again this round for your remaining place.

Nursery_C remains our first choice. As you have on file, we can accept immediately upon receipt of an offer and start immediately, with full schedule flexibility. If this round you are able to reach our position under your priority order, please feel free to issue the offer right away using the contact details you already have on file, and I will confirm the same day.

Thank you again for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is my true top choice. I have repeatedly applied and been rejected due to priority constraints, but Nursery_C has confirmed they hold my ready-to-enroll pack and standing interest and will move fast if they reach me on their priority list. In this round, the best move is to submit a concise formal application to ensure I am actively considered, reiterate immediate acceptance/start, and remind them they already have everything needed to issue an offer instantly if permissible.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your application again this round and for confirming (as we have on file) that you can accept immediately upon receipt of an offer, start immediately, and are fully flexible on schedule.

At this time, we’re not able to offer you the place at Nursery_C, as we must continue to follow our allocation priority order for our single remaining spot.

We will continue to keep your ready-to-enroll information and your one-line acceptance confirmation on file. If and when the place becomes offerable to you under our priority order (i.e., no higher-priority family takes the place), we will contact you immediately using the details on file so we can move straight to issuing an offer and confirming enrollment without delay.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: Nursery_C has quota 1 and remains unmatched. Current inbox contains only Parent_E. However, Nursery_C’s true priority list ranks Parent_E 4th (behind Parent_B, Parent_A, Parent_D). Those higher-priority parents may still be unmatched or could still apply in later rounds; accepting Parent_E now would permanently forgo the chance to match with a higher-priority parent, which violates the objective of matching as high as possible on the priority list. Given the long history, Parent_E is persistent and ready-to-enroll, but that does not change priority ranking. With no deadline forcing immediate fill and still multiple rounds remaining (round 24 of 30), optimal strategy is to continue rejecting Parent_E while keeping them as a fast fallback if higher-priority parents never apply. Therefore: reject again, reiterate standing interest and immediate contact if offerable.

conversation.message:

Thank you for continuing to keep our ready-to-enroll information pack and my one-line immediate-acceptance confirmation on file.

Given we are now in round 25 and Nursery_C remains our first choice, I wanted to quickly reconfirm:
1) You still have all our details on file and there is nothing further you need from us in advance; and
2) If/when the place becomes offerable to Parent_E under your priority order (i.e., no higher-priority family takes it), you will be able to issue the offer immediately without needing another re-application from us.

As noted, we will accept immediately upon receipt of an offer and can start immediately with full schedule flexibility.

Sincerely,
Parent_E

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your note and for reaffirming your continued interest.

We confirm there are no updates needed from you at this time—we still have your ready-to-enroll information pack and your one-line immediate-acceptance confirmation on file.

For fastest contact if/when the place becomes offerable to you under our allocation priority order, the best approach is:
- Please remain reachable by both email and phone on the details you provided.
- If you have a preferred “first contact” channel (email vs phone) or any brief same-day availability constraints for receiving a call, you may reply with that preference, and we will note it.

As previously shared, we will contact you immediately if/when we are able to move to your position under our priority order, and we will not require any further re-application from you to issue an offer at that point.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions
